intro: Myrsine australis, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small white or pinkish flowers followed by berries that are red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Myrsine australis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for native birds and insects.
